chapter.title: Drools
chapter.para:
openengsb-drools consists of 3 main parts
A Service Engine (SE) that recieves xml-messages and extracts knowledge to be sent to the rules-engine.
An external guvnor-server (that may run on the same or any other reachable machine)
A package with java-classes that build the shared model for the SE und Guvnor.

When the SE recieves a message, it parses the message into a java-object (Event). Then a rulebase-session is opened where the event is inserted. The rules specify their actions in java-code by calling methods on a helper-class, that is referenced as "helper" inside the rules. The rules for the rulebase are maintained in a guvnor-server which provides a webinterface. One may also use the eclipse-drools-plugin to interface with the server.
